results.title: Culloden
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.

results.title: Cullens Lake
results.creator_credit: David Corke and Victorian Field and Game Association
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Wetlands of Victoria”.
Cullens Lake is near Kerang in Victoria and provides an ideal habitat for many different varieties of water birds. It also provides a drought relief area for water birds that are forced to leave their usual habitat of inland rivers. This film looks at the lake and the birds that use it. Examines the threat to the lake by plans of the State Rivers and Water Commission of Victoria to turn it into a salinity basin. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Cul-de-Sac
results.creator_credit: Gene Gutowski, Compton and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Two wounded gangsters on the run descend upon a retired businessman living like a hermit with his young, bored and flirtatious French wife in an old castle on Holy Island, off the Northumberland coast. The arrival of the gangsters disrupts the couple’s eccentric relationship. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival, 1966) Cast includes Donald Pleasence, Francoise Dorleac, Jacqueline Bisset, Lionel Stander and Jack MacGowran.

results.title: Cuckoo, Mr. Edgar!
results.creator_credit: Therese Descary, ONF | NFB and Pierre M Trudeau
results.brief_description: One mid-Spring evening at midnight, a cuckoo bird is struck by lightning and thrown from his perch to the ground. In the morning when the storm has cleared, he makes his way back up the tree to discover that his comfortable and tidy home has been filled with three unhatched eggs. Pretty soon the eggs have hatched and in their place emerge three young live chicks that become his surrogate. The life of the routinely organised bird is thrown into disarray as his affection for the three grows. A delightful animated tale for children about the pleasures of parenting. Voice provided by A. J. Henderson. Original music by Louis Gagne.

results.title: Cuckoo-spit (Froghoppers)
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: An account of the life cycle of the froghopper showing all the stages of growth from the laying of eggs in the autumn through to the final change and emergence from the skin which takes place within the bubbles formation.

results.title: Cubism
results.creator_credit: George Barford and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Traces the development of cubism as a style of painting through the works of the artists who experimented with it. Shows how interest in Cezanne’s painting led Picasso and Braque to experiment with pictorial arrangement and to develop both analytical and synthetic cubism.

results.title: Cube
results.creator_credit: Trimark Pictures, Feature Film Project, Cube Libre, Mehra Meh, Betty Orr and Vincenzo Natali
results.brief_description: First time director Vincenzo Natali’s low budget thriller is a tribute to the ensemble cast performances as well as his direction. The action takes place in what appears to be an experiment in human survival as a select group of people wake up contained within the walls of a cube, twenty-six identical rooms wide and twenty-six high. How they got there is not made clear but finding their way out is the whole premise of the film. The skill-sets of this particular group of people aid or hinder their survival - for example, an old thief works out a way to find out if a room is booby-trapped or not - and survival is at stake because the cube kills and this is shown in scenes of visceral gore. The production design by Jasna Stefanovic, music by Mark Karven and some very believable special effects add to the tense but dreamlike sci-fi mood of the film. Human behaviour under stress provides the viewer with a gripping and edgy personal drama - even though ‘participants’ have been de-humanised by being used like guinea pigs in a maze. Cast includes Nicole DeBoer, Nicky Guardagni, David Hewlett, Andrew Miller, Julian Richings, Wayne Robson and Maurice Dean Wint.

results.title: Cuba and Haiti
results.creator_credit: Dawn Beresford, Jenny Dames and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Cuba is the largest and least commercialised country in the Caribbean. Political factors too have kept tourists away since Castro’s revolution in the fifties. Beginning his journey in the famous Cuban capital of Havana, Ian Wright travels across Cuba, skydiving onto a Havana beach, visiting a Cuban cigar factory, swimming with dolphins, visiting the Che Guevara University and watching a voodoo ceremony in Haiti. His journey ends in Haiti, the oldest black republic in the world.

results.title: Cuba and Fidel
results.creator_credit: Focal Point, Churchill Films, Christine Burrill, David Davis and Saul Landau
results.brief_description: The film focuses on an interview with Fidel Castro interwoven with aspects of Cuba. Castro speaks about differences with the United States which led to severed relations, about changes in Cuba since the revolution, about socialism and capitalism. He defends Cuba’s “coercive” society on economic grounds as a necessity during a transition period. The camera follows him on tours of inspection, particularly to a new housing project where he visits an apartment that overflows with residents. The film shows the contrasts of old and new, industrialization and poverty.

results.title: Cuba
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Arlene Sellers, Alex Winitsky and Richard Lester
results.brief_description: This very entertaining drama of adventure and romance is set in Havana in late 1959 as the corrupt regime of Cuba’s General Batista starts to crumble as Fidel Castro’s forces begin their takeover of the country. Sean Connery gives a powerful and compelling performance as a British soldier-of-fortune who hires himself out to venal Cuban general Martin Balsam to help put down the insurrection. He has no political views, but as he grows aware of the brutality and corruption of the regime and the gulf between Cuba’s rich and poor, his sympathies begin to shift…
